Submodules#

pyevolcomp.ObjectiveFunc module#

class ObjectiveFunc(mode: str = 'max', name: str = 'some function')[source]#

Bases: ABC

Abstract Fitness function class.

For each problem a new class will inherit from this one and implement the fitness function, random solution generation, mutation function and crossing of solutions.

fitness(indiv: Indiv, adjusted: bool = True) → float[source]#

Returns the value of the objective function given a vector changing the sign so that the optimization problem is solved by maximizing the fitness function.

abstract objective(vector: ndarray) → float[source]#

Implementation of the objective function.

abstract repair_solution(vector: ndarray) → ndarray[source]#

Transforms an invalid vector into one that satisfies the restrictions of the problem.

repair_speed(speed)[source]#

Transforms an invalid vector into one that satisfies the restrictions of the problem.

penalize(indiv: Indiv) → float[source]#

Gives a penalization to the fitness value of an individual if it violates any constraints propotional to how far it is to a viable solution.

If not implemented always returns 0.

class ObjectiveVectorFunc(vecsize: int, mode: str = 'max', low_lim: float = -100, up_lim: float = 100, name: str = 'some function')[source]#

Bases: ObjectiveFunc

repair_solution(vector: ndarray) → ndarray[source]#

Transforms an invalid vector into one that satisfies the restrictions of the problem.

class ObjectiveFromLambda(obj_func: callable, input_size: int, opt: str = 'max', low_lim: float = -100, up_lim: float = 100, name: str = None)[source]#

Bases: ObjectiveVectorFunc

objective(vector)[source]#

Implementation of the objective function.

repair_solution(vector)[source]#

Transforms an invalid vector into one that satisfies the restrictions of the problem.

pyevolcomp.Individual module#

class Individual(objfunc: ObjectiveFunc, genotype: Any, speed: np.ndarray = None, encoding: Encoding = None)[source]#

Bases: object

Individual that holds a tentative solution with its fitness.

property genotype: ndarray#

Gets the value of the vector.

apply_speed() → Individual[source]#

Apply the speed to obtain an individual with a new position.

property fitness: float#

Obtain the fitness of the individual, optimized to be calculated only once per individual.

get_state(show_speed: bool = True, show_op: bool = False, show_best: bool = False) → dict[source]#

Gets the current state of the algorithm as a dictionary.

pyevolcomp.Search module#

class Search(objfunc: ObjectiveFunc, search_strategy: Algorithm, params: ParamScheduler | dict = None)[source]#

Bases: ABC

General framework for metaheuristic algorithms

restart()[source]#

Resets the internal values of the algorithm and the number of evaluations of the fitness function.

save_solution(file_name='solution.csv')[source]#

Save the result of an execution to a csv file in disk.

best_solution()[source]#

Returns the best solution so far in the population.

stopping_condition(gen, real_time_start, cpu_time_start) → bool[source]#

Given the state of the algorithm, returns wether we have finished or not.

get_progress(gen, real_time_start, cpu_time_start) → float[source]#

Given the state of the algorithm, returns a number between 0 and 1 indicating how close to the end of the algorithm we are, 0 when starting and 1 when finished.

update(real_time_start, cpu_time_start, pass_step=True)[source]#

Given the state of the algorithm, returns a number between 0 and 1 indicating how close to the end of the algorithm we are, 0 when starting and 1 when finished.

initialize()[source]#

Generates a random population of individuals

abstract step(time_start=0, verbose=False) → Tuple[Individual, float][source]#

Performs a step in the algorithm

optimize() → Tuple[Individual, float][source]#

Execute the algorithm to get the best solution possible along with it’s evaluation

get_state(show_best_solution=True, show_fit_history=False, show_gen_history=False, show_pop=False, show_pop_details=False) → dict[source]#

Gets the current state of the algorithm as a dictionary

store_state(file_name='dumped_state.json', readable=False, show_best_solution=True, show_fit_history=False, show_gen_history=False, show_pop=False, show_pop_details=False)[source]#

Dumps the current state of the algorithm to a file.

Everything will be stored in a JSON file.

abstract step_info(start_time)[source]#

Displays information about the current state of the algotithm

abstract display_report(show_plots=True)[source]#

Shows a summary of the execution of the algorithm

parse_stopping_cond(condition_str: str) → List[str][source]#

This function parses an expression of the form “neval or cpu_time” into a tree structure so that it can be futher processed.

process_condition(cond_parsed, neval, ngen, real_time, cpu_time, target, patience) → bool[source]#

This function recieves as an input an expression for the stopping condition and the truth variable of the possible stopping conditions and returns wether to stop or not.

process_progress(cond_parsed, neval, ngen, real_time, cpu_time, target, patience) → float[source]#

This function recieves as an input an expression for the stopping condition and the truth variable of the possible stopping conditions and returns wether to stop or not.

pyevolcomp.Algorithm module#

class Algorithm(pop_init: Initializer, params: ParamScheduler | dict = None, name: str = 'some algorithm')[source]#

Bases: ABC

Population of the Genetic algorithm Note: for methods that use only one solution at a time, use a population of length 1 to store it.

property pop_size#
best_solution()[source]#

Gives the best solution found by the algorithm and its fitness

initialize(objfunc: ObjectiveFunc)[source]#

Generates a random population of individuals

select_parents(population: List[Individual], progress: float = 0, history: List[float] = None) → List[Individual][source]#

Selects the individuals that will be perturbed in this generation Returns the whole population if not implemented.

abstract perturb(parent_list: List[Individual], progress: float, objfunc: ObjectiveFunc, history: List[float]) → List[Individual][source]#

Applies operators to the population in some way Returns the offspring generated.

select_individuals(population: List[Individual], offspring: List[Individual], progress: float = 0, history: List[float] = None) → List[Individual][source]#

Selects the individuals that will pass to the next generation. Returns the offspring if not implemented.

update_params(progress: float = 0)[source]#

Updates the parameters and the operators

get_state(show_pop: bool = False, show_pop_details: bool = False) → dict[source]#

Gets the current state of the algorithm as a dictionary.

extra_step_info()[source]#

Specific information to display relevant to this algorithm

extra_report(show_plots: bool)[source]#

Specific information to display relevant to this algorithm

pyevolcomp.Encoding module#

class Encoding[source]#

Bases: ABC

Base class for transforming between phenotype and genotype

abstract encode(phenotype)[source]#

Encodes a viable solution to our problem to the encoding used in each individual of the algorithm

abstract decode(genotype)[source]#

Decodes the contents of an individual to a viable solution to our problem

pyevolcomp.ParamScheduler module#

class ParamScheduler(strategy: str, param_schedule: dict)[source]#

Bases: object

This class is responsible of varying the parameters of an algorithm over time.

reset()[source]#

Sets all the parameters to their initial values

get_params() → dict[source]#

Returns a dictionary containing the current parameters

get_state() → dict[source]#

Gets the current state of the algorithm as a dictionary.

step(progress: float)[source]#

Changes the values of the parameters interpolating between the initial and final values.

pyevolcomp.utils module#

class NumpyEncoder(*, skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, default=None)[source]#

Bases: JSONEncoder

Special json encoder for numpy types

default(obj)[source]#

Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns a serializable object for o, or calls the base implementation (to raise a TypeError).

For example, to support arbitrary iterators, you could implement default like this:

def default(self, o):
    try:
        iterable = iter(o)
    except TypeError:
        pass
    else:
        return list(iterable)
    # Let the base class default method raise the TypeError
    return JSONEncoder.default(self, o)
